intro: Goniostemma punctatum, commonly known as the spotted goniostemma, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with alternating leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by distinctive berries that turn red when mature. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a woody stem with thorn-like projections. It is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
